string.text: It has been ten years since the accession of Rome’s co-emperors, Valentinian and Valens. In the west, Valentinian’s adept leadership has quashed usurpations, improved the Empire’s infrastructure, and benefitted the population of the empire as a whole. Now, the empire stands at a precipice: Valentinian’s blindness to the excesses of his officials has resulted in rampant corruption and disloyalty, while Pannonia has been ravaged by the Quadians, incensed at the Roman assassination of their king.
